intro: Galium amani, commonly known as the Amani bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa, particularly in the countries of Tanzania and Kenya. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces clusters of tiny, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Galium amani is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth and rocky slopes.
